cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 105 mi SSE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly tracking north-northwest toward the South-North Carolina coastline, then curving northward across coastal North Carolina and accelerating toward the Mid-Atlantic offshore waters.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear / Wilmington, North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC (includes Cape Fear and Wilmington area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina coastline, especially Cape Fear to Myrtle Beach
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely; sustained 40–50 kt (45–60 mph) with higher gusts possible around landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft above ground at times of high tide along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches common with isolated amounts up to 5 inches across coastal SE North Carolina.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents affecting port approaches and pilot stations.
